options.help:
What Are Redirects?

Redirects automatically send visitors from old URLs to new ones when content moves or changes.

Setting Up Redirects

  • URL From: The old path (must be relative, like /old-about-us)
  • URL To: Where visitors should go (can be relative or full URL)
  • Response Code: Choose 301 (permanent) or 302 (temporary)

Automatic Redirects

When you change a published page's URL, there's a Flow that automatically creates redirects to prevent broken links. You can disable this in the Settings -> Flows.

Best Practices

  • Keep URLs descriptive but concise
  • Regularly review and clean up old redirects
  • Avoid redirect chains
  • Test redirects before publishing
